intro: Erysimum kykkoticum, commonly known as the Kykkotic Brassica, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or pale purple, and it blooms in the spring. Erysimum kykkoticum is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cold, arid environments.
